body.p:
Falmouth
Nov 12t 1860
Hon -- B -- Magoffin
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir:
An old Man of our county by the name of Lewis Perry was some time since fined the sum of twenty three dollars & 20ct for Profane Swearing, in the presence of Alfred Riley Esquire.

I am informed and believe that Perry is a civil old man and was intoxicated when he Committed the offence, He is a poor man with a family, and I have no doubt that your interposition would be an act of humnity and perfectly right -- The fine of twenty three Dollars & 20 cts ($23,,20) was done all at the same time:

It is a very small matter and would not do any thing in the matter only on account of his condition, he being poor & a cripple
and further believing ^that the fine is^ unreasonable and unjust,
It stands thus on Equire Rileys Docket, "For swearing thirty" "profane oaths on the 19th of June 1860' "fine $23,,20 costs 4,,75 constables" "half Commission 83 cts -- on replevin" "bond."
Such are the facts and what you do will be satisfactory to me. Though I hope you will interpose in his behalf, if so send to me --

Pendleton Cir. Ct
$23.20/100 } Profane Swearing
Lewis Perry
Issd Nov 22. 1860
